channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14462] rolling_restart.sh --master-only throws "line 142: test: 0: unary operator expected"
item.description: I was trying to run this on distributed cluster (master branch build) and ended up with this error. Looking in to this,
item.summary: rolling_restart.sh --master-only throws "line 142: test: 0: unary operator expected"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: As far as i can see we are not using "/hbase/region-in-transition" znode to track regions while master is restarted. Is that correct ?

Here is patch solving this issue, i have added code to check if "/hbase/region-in-transition" znode exist and if not script complete masters restart.
If we are not using "region-in-transition" znode we should remove this part of script in future.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12762591/HBASE-14462.patch
against master branch at commit 526520de0a9d7a29fcf1b4c521f017ca75a46cbc.

or dev-support patch that doesn't require tests.

This message is automatically generated.

Looks good overall.


+    ret=$?

     echo -n "Waiting for ${zunassigned} to empty"

     while true ; do

+      if test 0 -eq ${ret}

+      then

The ${ret} is only used once, right ?
Consider lifting the check out of while loop.
Here is new patch lifting check for "/hbase/region-in-transition" znode out loop.

+ ritZnodeCheck=`$bin/hbase zkcli stat $

+ unassigned=`$bin/hbase zkcli stat ${zunassigned}

2>&1 |grep -e 'numChildren = '|sed -e 's,numChildren = ,,'`
